thread.title: Sports briefs: Mets win N.L. pennant
thread.title_full: Sports briefs: Mets win N.L. pennant

title: Sports briefs: Mets win N.L. pennant
text: Sports briefs: Mets win N.L. pennant fosters.com Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 3:15 AM Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 3:15 AM CHICAGO — Daniel Murphy homered in his record sixth straight postseason game and the New York Mets reached the World Series for the first time in 15 years, beating the Chicago Cubs 8-3 Wednesday night for a playoff sweep. Manager Terry Collins' team never trailed for a single inning in taking all four games in the NL Championship Series. New York, seeking its first title since 1986, will play Game 1 of the World Series at either Kansas City or Toronto on Tuesday night. The Royals lead the AL Championship Series 3-2. Murphy broke the postseason mark set by Houston's Carlos Beltran in 2004 with a two-run drive in the eighth inning. Lucas Duda homered and drove in five runs. Travis d'Arnaud also connected as the Mets advanced to their first World Series since 2000. Kris Bryant homered for Chicago, but a championship drought dating to 1908 continues. Joe Maddon's young team had many believing this might be the year, but the Cubs did little against the Mets' fresh aces. — The Associated Press College basketball UNH women picked third in AE DURHAM — The University of New Hampshire women's basketball team was picked third in the 2015-16 America East preseason coaches' poll and senior guard Elizabeth Belanger was named to the preseason all-conference team. Defending champion Albany (N.Y.) was picked first, followed by Maine. After UNH, Stony Brook (N.Y.), Hartford (Conn.), Maryland-Baltimore County, UMass-Lowell, Vermont and Binghamton (N.Y.) rounded out the ballot. UNH was fourth last season. — Staff reports NFL Jets' Ridley practices FLORHAM PARK, N.J. (AP) — New York Jets running back Stevan Ridley has practiced for the first time this season and could face the New England Patriots, his former teammates. Ridley is currently on the physically unable to perform list after tearing the anterior cruciate and medial collateral ligaments in his right knee while with the Patriots last season. Coach Todd Bowles says Wednesday that there's "a chance" Ridley could play Sunday. Ridley was a full participant at practice, but Bowles wants to see how he feels as the week progresses. Cornerback Dee Milliner, on short-term injured reserve, also fully participated but must miss two more games before he can be activated. Cornerback Buster Skrine (concussion), safety Jaiquawn Jarrett (knee) and running back Bilal Powell (ankle) all sat out. — The Associated Press High school soccer Marshwood to host tourney game SOUTH BERWICK, Maine — The Marshwood High School girls soccer team will host Cheverus in a preliminary round Southern Maine Class A playoff on Friday at 5 p.m. Marshwood fell 2-0 to Gorham on Tuesday night to wrap up the regular season, which it finished with a 10-4 record. — Staff reports
